content.raw:
I don't seem to be able to reproduce this, either on my laptop or on fido:


```
#!bash

atmyers@fido ~/yt-conda/src/yt-hg $ nosetests --local-dir=/home/atmyers/yt-test_outputs --with-answer-testing --answer-big-data --local visualization/volume_rendering/tests/test_mesh_render.py:test_hex8_render --answer-name=local_mesh --answer-store
..
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 2 tests in 2.034s

OK
atmyers@fido ~/yt-conda/src/yt-hg $ hg summary
parent: 19063:a3d319a05e3a tip
 fixing the position attribute setter for Camera.
branch: yt
commit: 9 unknown (clean)
update: 15 new changesets, 3 branch heads (merge)
```

I can also run the following commands without error:


```
#!python

from yt.utilities.answer_testing.framework import data_dir_load
ds = data_dir_load("MOOSE_sample_data/out.e-s010", kwargs={'step':-1})
```

pullrequest.title: Answer tests for unstructured mesh renderings

content.raw: Just one comment (which I added inline and bitbucket deleted...): you can probably delete the `switch_orientation` call in `set_position`, as with your change the `position` property now does this automatically.
content.html: Just one comment (which I added inline and bitbucket deleted...): you can probably delete the switch_orientation call in set_position, as with your change the position property now does this automatically.

pullrequest.title: Answer tests for unstructured mesh renderings

content.raw: Currently, the `set_position` method lets you optionally pass in a north_vector argument to `switch_orientation`, while using the property doesn't, so deleting that line would involve some change of behavior.
content.html: Currently, the set_position method lets you optionally pass in a north_vector argument to switch_orientation, while using the property doesn't, so deleting that line would involve some change of behavior.

pullrequest.title: Answer tests for unstructured mesh renderings

description:
This adds a set of image comparison tests for unstructured mesh renderings. There are a few other tweaks as well:

1. Adding wedge element examples to the docs. 
2. Tweaking another one of the doc examples so that the north vector matches the other images.
3. Making the Camera set up square images by default - the current approach gives incorrect image aspect ratios for non-cubic datasets.
4. Slightly padding the domain boundaries for ExodusII Datasets - this makes the default choices made by the Camera more reasonable.
5. I'm also fixing the position attribute setter for Camera so that it updates the normal_vector, too.
